description: The seminar is designed to prepare students to undertake original, primary research in law. Major topics and questions to be covered include: - how to write a good literature review and prospectus; - why one must have a method, or, how are 'methods' and 'data collection' related?; - what is research design?; - how to avoid, or manage, the problem of 'selection bias.' A major component of the seminar, students will assess a variety of published papers, as well as research projects presented by the faculty.
title: Legal Research: Method & Design
